alert.note: Alert for Latimer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 08 at 4:23PM CST until February 10 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of west central Arkansas and Oklahoma, including the following counties, in west central Arkansas, Franklin and Sebastian. In Oklahoma, Latimer, Le Flore, Pushmataha and Sequoyah. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations will continue to occur. Low-water crossings may be inundated with water and not passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 420 PM CST, Doppler radar detected spotty showers and isolated storms in the area. Flooding is either ongoing or expected to occur in the warned area. Radar estimates that between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Smith... Poteau... Charleston... Greenwood... Barling... Pocola... Heavener... Lavaca... Spiro... Arkoma... Panama... Talihina... Wister... Hackett... Howe... Altus... Hartford... Huntington... Bonanza... Bokoshe... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
